title: So if champions with 1-3 dashes deal more damage then champions with no dashes then whats the point?
body: Whats the point of picking an immobile champion? The more dashes you have the safer you are and if your doing more damage then people less safe then you then whats the tipping point of picking an immobile champion?

replies.body:
Immobile champions all get major boosts to power budget, either turough range, damage, lowered CDs, utility, or any combination of such.

Damage isnt the only stat in the game (although most immobile champs have top tier damage in their class)
You mean like Talon and LeBlanc? or do you mean Kassadin?

I think he means Camille actually. Poor girl is useless because her mobility eats up her whole power budget. Can't even contest with all the Juggernauts top lane.

/s
Her hardest counter is a Juggernaut, Illaoi...
Wow, one hard match up...poor Camille

Camille now loses most matchups toplane. 
Pretty much everyone. 
Tht's why she is played jungle now and not toplane.

They nerfed her because of how much power she had in the toplane so then she moved to jungle to maintain relevancy. She's still playable toplane, its just people don't actually know how to play her after her first rotation of spells. They became so used to how reliant her damage was that when she was actually balanced people complained she is "too weak" in the toplane.
you must not be very good at the game if you think illaoi is good against cam

[I mean given that I found this information through a stats site instead of my own experience](https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/champion/Camille/)...

But let's run a small thought experiment. One of Camille's best selling points is her ability to lock somebody down in one place and fight them down with her true damage and pseudo-DPS damage style. Illaoi wants to stay in one place to maximize tentacles either through her Passive or her Ultimate and as a Juggernaut statchecks most every matchup in the game. Who wins?

using plat+ for cam is about as dumb as using plat+ for akali or azir, camilles best selling point is her ability to quickly go in and out of trades and mitigating damage with her passive while doing so, ya know how juggernauts need time to deal their damage?

Camille is no where near the level of Azir or even Akali in terms of complexity. 

On top of that, it makes sense that Illaoi beats her.

She will always win a war of attrition because her E is much better poke - and forces Camille to fight her in melee range.

Destroys camille in melee range - with a much quicker and pretty hefty burst trade.

Kassadin doesnt have all that great damage, and the rest are assassins who all have high burst, low sustained damage, and almost entirely single target damage.

Brand, on the other hand, is immobile but has masses of AoE damage with little investment. Same with velk and zyra.

Annie has a reliable, low CD AoE or point and click stun, and is very tanky with E.

TF has a point and click stun, bonus gold passive, map teleport, and long range waveclear/poke. (Counting hin as immobile because ult is not in combat useable without almost certain death.)

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=n2Y3UMuj,comment-id=000200000001,timestamp=2018-10-08T17:28:51.325+0000)
>
> Kassadin doesnt have all that great damage

/thread boys

Say, in a teamfight, who does more damage? A 2 item LeBlanc, or a 2 item Darius? 
A Fizz and a Nasus?
A Zed and a Garen?
A Talon and an Illaoi?

Oh wow guys! I can't believe that different champions can have different roles in fights!! Like, a Zed should do as much AoE damage as an Illaoi, and a Fizz should do as much damage to turrets as a Nasus right?  Because all champions are definitely supposed to have the same role and should all be judged by how much total damage they can output, not whether or not they can do their job properly (assassinate vs bruise). Good to know!! I'll remember that for the future!

Leblanc, Fizz, Zed, Talon taking out your carries while chunking out your frontline. Darius and Garen are faster than Illoai and Nasus, but are still kitable depending on how even everyone is, and how people play. 
If your team doesn't know what their doing, then yeah, a Darius, Garen, Nasus, or, how if the fuck would this happen, Illoai will get into the back line, but that means you guys made a mistake.
Sorry, didn't realise that damage doesn't apply to the frontline. Thats half the point of mobility, to get past the frontline.

Talon and Kassadin are melee, and LeBlanc's W literally drops her face first into a fight. [Talon, LeBlanc, and Kassadin are all incredibly outclassed in terms of raw damage to, surprise, immobile mages](https://champion.gg/statistics/#?sortBy=general.totalDamageDealtToChampions&order=descend&roleSort=Middle). Not to mention Kassadin and Talon can only contribute soft CC, or LeBlanc a delayed snare.

> [{quoted}](name=TehNACHO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=n2Y3UMuj,comment-id=000200000002,timestamp=2018-10-08T17:29:51.539+0000)
>
> Talon and Kassadin are melee, and LeBlanc's W literally drops her face first into a fight. [Talon, LeBlanc, and Kassadin are all incredibly outclassed in terms of raw damage to, surprise, immobile mages](https://champion.gg/statistics/#?sortBy=general.totalDamageDealtToChampions&order=descend&roleSort=Middle). Not to mention Kassadin and Talon can only contribute soft CC, or LeBlanc a delayed snare.

Kassadin has CRAZY damage especially when you have fully stacked R.

Right, in very specific instances he has a lot of damage.

But this applies to all champions. And statistically, champions like Ziggs, Xerath, and to absolutely nobody's surprise Karthus tend to do far more damage than Kassadin could ever hope to over the course of an entire game.

> [{quoted}](name=TehNACHO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=n2Y3UMuj,comment-id=00020000000200000000,timestamp=2018-10-09T01:20:26.062+0000)
>
> Right, in very specific instances he has a lot of damage.
> 
> But this applies to all champions. And statistically, champions like Ziggs, Xerath, and to absolutely nobody's surprise Karthus tend to do far more damage than Kassadin could ever hope to over the course of an entire game.

Late game he is unbeatable. It is basically gg once it reaches there.
Again you're just throwing specific instances. Overall though, it doesn't matter because on average Ziggs and Xerath and a plethora of other AOE Mages beat Kassadin in raw damage.

> [{quoted}](name=TehNACHO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=n2Y3UMuj,comment-id=0002000000020000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-09T04:40:56.086+0000)
>
> Again you're just throwing specific instances. Overall though, it doesn't matter because on average Ziggs and Xerath and a plethora of other AOE Mages beat Kassadin in raw damage.

Lol, that is like saying you dont deal damage if you dont land ur spells. As Kassadin, lategame, your supposed to use your ultimate for damage. It is part of his burst, and it is A LOT of damage. 

Ziggs and Xerath both do a lot, but Kassadin does even MORE and much more reliably as well since his damage is very difficult to dodge and is instant.

[Except over the course of a given game, he doesn't](https://champion.gg/statistics/#?sortBy=general.totalDamageDealtToChampions&order=descend&roleSort=Middle&roleSort=Middle&order=descend).

Look, you and I are saying two different things. You are giving specific instances where Kassadin is obviously stronger than most Mages. I'm saying over the course of a given game, Mages statistically do more damage than Kassadin does though. You're arguing oranges to my apples.

EDIT: *Sigh* the link keeps breaking if I link it through the boards. Click through manually to sort for Mid Lane by Damage Dealt to champions. Kassadin scores in 28th place in terms of damage dealt over the course of a game as opposed to Ziggs and Xerath who score second and third place respectively.

> [{quoted}](name=BurakkuRozu9,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=n2Y3UMuj,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-10-08T17:09:36.958+0000)
>
> You mean like Talon and LeBlanc? or do you mean Kassadin?

or like Kha'zix ... let's not start with VI, LEE ...

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=n2Y3UMuj,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-08T17:08:47.390+0000)
>
> Immobile champions all get major boosts to power budget, either turough range, damage, lowered CDs, utility, or any combination of such.
> 
> Damage isnt the only stat in the game (although most immobile champs have top tier damage in their class)

Disagree. Champs like irelia and Jax don't lose any of their power budget to speak of

Irelia and jax have limited mobility in that they require an enemy target and setups for resets (irelia) or a friendly/enemy target for jax. Both are melee, and both have good dueling potential against auto attack users. However, champions of similar class that are immobile, such as garen and darius, both have their own boons. Darius is tanky with higher threat as the battle goes on, with lots of free stats later, and garen gets, again, better general tanky stats, a silence, better aoe damage. Both have executes, and both have sustain.

Y'know it always irks me how despite irelia being bullshit right now melee champs always need tons of counterplay with skillshots, slow animations, specific setup and target acquisition and then there is ranged champs who point and click delete everyone in two clicks.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=n2Y3UMuj,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-08T17:08:47.390+0000)
>
> Immobile champions all get major boosts to power budget, either turough range, damage, lowered CDs, utility, or any combination of such.
> 
> Damage isnt the only stat in the game (although most immobile champs have top tier damage in their class)

And then there's champs like {{champion:39}} {{champion:164}} {{champion:157}} Who get all of the above.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=n2Y3UMuj,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-08T17:08:47.390+0000)
>
> Immobile champions all get major boosts to power budget, either turough range, damage, lowered CDs, utility, or any combination of such.
> 
> Damage isnt the only stat in the game (although most immobile champs have top tier damage in their class)

Like? 
Graves? Kaisa? Aatrox? Urgot? Jax? Akali? Jhin? Khazix? Fiora? Le Blanc? Kassadin? Evelyn? Ahri? 
All those are top tier (Currently) altho we can Argue that Aatrox and Evelyn aren't but all of them have a lot of mobility, (Yes Jhin with 600-700 Movespeed at 1 item makes him a mobile champion) 

The only good immobile champs currently are Malzahar and MF. 
While all the rest have some sort of dash, leap, steroid speed, jump, etc...

Jhin is immobile, kai sa has very limited access to her mobility (r requires a passive stack), urgot isnt exactly mobile (his only movement isnt much faster than walking, short ranged, telegraphed, slow).

Movement speed alone isnt mobility.

Ashe is immobile, gets massive ammounts of utility, as does varus. Kog is immobile, and has the highest damage rating of all rADCs. Twitch gets stealth and AoE autos.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=n2Y3UMuj,comment-id=000200040000,timestamp=2018-10-09T12:50:49.375+0000)
>
> Jhin is immobile, kai sa has very limited access to her mobility (r requires a passive stack), urgot isnt exactly mobile (his only movement isnt much faster than walking, short ranged, telegraphed, slow).
> 
> Movement speed alone isnt mobility.
> 
> Ashe is immobile, gets massive ammounts of utility, as does varus. Kog is immobile, and has the highest damage rating of all rADCs. Twitch gets stealth and AoE autos.

Running with 700 Movepseed makes you mobile. 
Kaisa can use her ult and her E which gives her invisibility+Movespeed boost+Attack Speed boost. 

Yes Ashe is immobile, which is exactly why she has a a 2% pick rate and a sub 50% winrate, in this meta, if you don't play mobile/broken champions then your chances of winning are significantly reduced.

Ashe has a low solo queue winrate for the same reason ryze does; shes better on a coordinated team.

Running with 700 MS only on certain autos with below average auto range for an ADC and only after 3 items or so does not make you mobile.

Kai sa is mobile with ult, long CD movespeed isnt really all that mobile.

Rigth now lack of mobility is only a disadvantage. Period.

Back in the day, inmobile champions use to have some kind of crazy shit to compensate for it, like very long range, massive burst damage, or hard CCs. But nowadays champions with mobility also have those things, so.... power creep, much.
Well immobile champions must have something - because then otherwise immobile champions wouldn't be doing fine statisically.

> [{quoted}](name=charge attack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=n2Y3UMuj,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2018-10-08T23:00:04.969+0000)
>
> Well immobile champions must have something - because then otherwise immobile champions wouldn't be doing fine statisically.

They do its called a skilled playerbase. You have to play immobile champions SOOOOO much better than the dash champs that bad players simply dont pick them once they figure out they can do better with dash champs covering up their poor play. Good players play dash champs as well but bad players really dont play immobile ones much too hard and punishing for poor play.

Yep, and that's exactly why I never trust anyone that says their "hard to master" assassin takes skill. It doesn't even come close to nearly enough skill required to pilot any immobile mage, since unlike every mobile "requires skill" cancer in this game, you don't get the privilege of thousands free out of jail cards. You fuck up/misposition once you most likely die but on assassin it's a breeze situation most of the time.

Lol it’s crazy how players will just jack off each other. “Immobile mages are so much harder”.

Fuck no. Orianna is a billion times easier at actually winning games with mobile champions like Zed/Akali.

Skilled playerbase my ass lmao. Garen and Darius dominate Bronze. 

If immobile champions actually had NO DRAWBACKS and ONLY more mobility - they would be the only picks in the highest level of play. Why isn’t competitive just Zed and Leblanc every game? They’re _clearly_ just as powerful as an immobile mage just more mobility xd.
Not like mages have better waveclear, more teamfight Impact in terms of AOE damage and utility/zoning, as well as outscaling.

Yeah the guys playing immobile champs are just dedicated and play them way better. 
Like why pick a darius who if he missteps and missuses his E is a sitting duck and dies when i can play kha jump into five people, kill one and stealth/jump out?
Because kha can't tank or sustain. He's great at taking out other mobile champions though.

Seriously? I just want to know if you’re serious here.

Kha can jump in 1v5 and get a kill - fucking lmao.

Darius is just a “sitting duck”. Yeah, a sitting duck with fuck tons of damage, and 3.5k health. 

You’re actually delusional.

Mobility should be at the cost of damage same with Tankyness.

Riot just has no clue what balance is.

Oh man, it's almost as if balance isn't hyper binary in this case between mobility and damage. It's not like the vast majority of immobile mages have ridiculous waveclear and zoning potential compared to most mobile champions. It's not like the vast majority of Juggernauts and heavy fighters straight up statcheck mobile champs assuming you aren't playing that stupidly. It's not like immobile ADCs like Jinx, Kog'Maw, or Draven break solo Q when they're strong and Varus and Ashe are mainstays in the competitive scene for their utility.

Everyone's being incredibly vague here. If you do a one to one analysis between any mobile champion and any immobile champion, the immobile champion is probably still gonna have a trait that straight up outclasses the mobile one, save for incredibly old and not so great designs like Shyvana or old Nunu.

Ekko and Ahri's waveclear aren't even as good as say, Xerath or Ziggs?

We have two different definitions for zoning apparently.

~~Jax is statchecked by heavier fighters.~~

Edit, stand corrected on the last point. Said it based on the fact that Garen used to be a hard counter to Jax, but this has changed over the fact that Garens started maxing Q first.

> [{quoted}](name=Yara0,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=n2Y3UMuj,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-10-08T17:04:03.590+0000)
>
> Whats the point of picking an immobile champion? The more dashes you have the safer you are and if your doing more damage then people less safe then you then whats the tipping point of picking an immobile champion?

ITs even worse to be honest, riot seems to insist on putting the full DPS of a kit on them so they actually do MORE dmg with less abilities and get the bonus of their dash utility. Like the new akali does more dmg with her abilities even though 1 does nothing but makes a shroud lol. What i mean is Akali shroud does no dmg but her other 2 non abilities get scaled to do as much dmg (include CD not just abilities dmg)) as other champs 3 non ults, making them stronger in every way.

You see this over and over, another great example is ekko who basically just fishes for free kills because his qwe are over stacked then just using his R to escape.

champions with high mobility should have over all lower ability not a little but significant yet they don;t they get equal dmg and then just gain the advantage of their mobility/utility and actually get to put out their dmg even faster. This is why league of legends balance team is turbo trash. Even sadder is every new champ and rework keeps doubling down on this incompetent design balance.
Interesting Topic.
Immobile champions are usually harder scalers than mobile champions, but of course we're not going to ACTUALLY think about that.

> [{quoted}](name=chipndip1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=n2Y3UMuj,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2018-10-08T22:01:13.996+0000)
>

Uhm no they arent lol, like literally just spew random lies and pretend they are facts hahaha.
